intro: Ionopsidium megalospermum, commonly known as the large-seeded ionopsidium, is a perennial shrub native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, which is characterized by succulent leaves and flowers. Ionopsidium megalospermum is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its succulent tissues. It plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
